00273 #ifndef _PGF_FILE_H
00274 #define _PGF_FILE_H
00275 
00276 #include "TsvFile.h"
00277 #include "util/Err.h"
00278 
00279 namespace affx {
00280   class PgfFile;
00281 };
00282 
00286 class affx::PgfFile {
00287 public:
00288 #ifndef SWIG
00290   affx::TsvFile m_tsv;
00291 #endif
00292   // There isnt a "m_" prefix on these, as I want to seperate them out
00293   // from the "real" member variables. This will make it
00294   // easy for people to write "pgf.atom_id".
00295   // (No annoying prefix.)
00296 
00297   //#%header0=
00298   int probeset_id;            
00299   std::string probeset_type;  
00300   std::string probeset_name;  
00301   //#%header1=
00302   int atom_id;                
00303   //#%header2=
00304   int probe_id;               
00305   std::string probe_type;     
00306   int gc_count;               
00307   int probe_length;           
00308   int interrogation_position; 
00309   std::string probe_sequence; 
00310   int exon_position;          
00311 
00313   PgfFile() {
00314     probeset_id = -1;
00315     probeset_type = "";
00316     probeset_name = "";
00317     atom_id = -1;
00318     probe_id = -1;
00319     probe_type = "";
00320     gc_count = -1;
00321     probe_length = -1;
00322     interrogation_position = -1;
00323     probe_sequence = "";
00324     makePgfBindings();
00325   }
00326 
00328   ~PgfFile() {
00329   }
00330 
00332   void makePgfBindings() {
00333     // start afresh
00334     m_tsv.unbindAll();
00335     //#%header0=
00336     m_tsv.bind(0,"probeset_id",&probeset_id,TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00337     m_tsv.bind(0,"type",&probeset_type);
00338     m_tsv.bind(0,"probeset_name",&probeset_name);
00339     //#%header1="
00340     m_tsv.bind(1,"atom_id",&atom_id,TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00341     //#%header2=
00342     m_tsv.bind(2,"probe_id",&probe_id,TSV_BIND_REQUIRED);
00343     m_tsv.bind(2,"type",&probe_type);
00344     m_tsv.bind(2,"gc_count",&gc_count);
00345     m_tsv.bind(2,"probe_length",&probe_length);
00346     m_tsv.bind(2,"interrogation_position",&interrogation_position);
00347     m_tsv.bind(2,"probe_sequence",&probe_sequence);
00348     // this seems to be unused...
00349     // m_tsv.bind(2,"exon_position",&exon_position);
00350   }
00354   int open(std::string filename) {
00355     std::string val;
00356     int rc = m_tsv.open(filename);
00357     if(rc == TSV_OK) {
00358       int rv=m_tsv.getHeader("pgf_format_version",val);
00359       Err::check(rv==TSV_OK,"No pgf_format_version header in pgf file");
00360       Err::check(val.compare("1.0")==0,"Unable to handle pgf file format");
00361     }
00362     return rc;
00363   }
00367   int write(std::string filename) {
00368     return m_tsv.writeTsv(filename);
00369   }
00372   int close() {
00373     return m_tsv.close();
00374   }
00377   int rewind() {
00378     return m_tsv.rewind();
00379   }
00382   int next_probeset() {
00383     return m_tsv.nextLevel(0);
00384   }
00387   int next_atom() {
00388     return m_tsv.nextLevel(1);
00389   }
00392   int next_probe() {
00393     return m_tsv.nextLevel(2);
00394   }
00398   int defineFilePgf(TsvFile* tsv) {
00399     Err::check(tsv!=NULL,"affx::PgfFile - no tsv file provided to defineFilePgf");
00400     // note embedded "\t"s and "\n"s.
00401     return tsv->defineFile("probeset_id\ttype\tprobeset_name\n"
00402                            "atom_id\n"
00403                            "probe_id\ttype\tgc_count\tprobe_length\t" // line break for length.
00404                            "interrogation_position\tprobe_sequence\texon_position\n");
00405   }
00408   int defineFilePgf() {
00409     return defineFilePgf(&m_tsv);
00410   }
00411 
00414   affx::TsvFile* tsv_ptr() {
00415     return &m_tsv;
00416   }
00417 };
00418 
00419 #endif // TsvFile
